The Future of Being Human

Experts predict significant changes in people's ways of thinking, being, and doing as they adapt to the age of AI. Many are concerned about how AI adoption will affect essential traits such as empathy, social/emotional intelligence, complex thinking, ability to act independently, and sense of purpose. Some hope for AIs' influence on humans' curiosity, decision-making, and creativity.

Key Concepts:

  • The impact of AI on human traits
  • The future of being human in the age of AI
  • The potential effects of AI on human behavior and society
  • Blurring of boundaries between human and synthetic creations
  • Shifts in power relations and social structures
  • Impact of AI on identity, autonomy, and responsibility
  • The impact of AI on human autonomy and civic virtues
  • The potential for AI to exacerbate societal divisions and misinformation
  • The emergence of a new digital divide based on AI literacy
AI empathy social/emotional intelligence complex thinking independence purpose curiosity decision-making creativity artificial intelligence
Research Intermediate
